# isEqual(to:)

**Instance Method**

Compares the receiving array to another array.

## Declaration

```swift
func isEqual(to otherArray: [Any]) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **otherArray**: An array.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the contents of `otherArray` are equal to the contents of the receiving array, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

Two arrays have equal contents if they each hold the same number of objects and objects at a given index in each array satisfy the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObjectProtocol/isEqual(_:)] test.

## Comparing Arrays

- **firstObjectCommon(with:)**: Returns the first object contained in the receiving array that’s equal to an object in another given array.
